docs.title: 250 - Count Univalue Subtrees
docs.text:
class Node:
    def __init__(self, val):
        self.val = val
        self.left = None
        self.right = None


def countUnivalSubtrees(root: Node) -> int:
    """Return the number of univalue subtrees."""

    if root is None:
        return 0

    count = [0]
    isUnival(root, count)
    return count[0]


def isUnival(node: Node, count) -> bool:
    """Return True if the tree rooted at the given node is an univalue subtree.
       Assumptions:
       (1) node is not None
       (2) count is a list of size 1
    """

    if node.left is None and node.right is None:
        count[0] += 1
        return True

    elif node.left is not None and node.right is None:
        if isUnival(node.left, count) and node.val == node.left.val:
            count[0] += 1
            return True

    elif node.left is None and node.right is not None:
        if isUnival(node.right, count) and node.val == node.right.val:
            count[0] += 1
            return True

    else:
        leftIsUnival = isUnival(node.left, count)
        rightIsUnival = isUnival(node.right, count)
        if leftIsUnival and rightIsUnival and node.val == node.left.val and node.val == node.right.val:
            count[0] += 1
            return True

    return False
